summary: An email from Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman discussing photos of Jeffrey Epstein's cell, focusing on an electric cord on the door and the undisturbed state of the top bunk, suggesting analysis of the death scene.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Sends an email analyzing photos of Jeffrey Epstein's cell, pointing out details about an electric cord and the bunk to argue against the suicide narrative.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Attorney who is the recipient of Mark Epstein's email containing analysis of cell photos related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; the analysis pertains to photos of his jail cell following his death.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is sending analytical information to attorney Stacey Richman, suggesting a legal or investigative collaboration.
Mark Epstein is analyzing the death scene of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a familial connection and involvement in the case.

events.title: Analysis of Epstein Cell Photos
events.description: Mark Epstein analyzes photos of Jeffrey Epstein's jail cell, noting an electric cord on the door and that the top bunk appears undisturbed, arguing against a suicide by hanging from the bunk.

keyFacts: Photos of Jeffrey Epstein's cell show an electric cord on the outside and inside of the door, and it had been handled.
The top bunk showed no signs of disturbance, with items still in place, suggesting no one jumped from it.
Mark Epstein is actively analyzing forensic details of the death scene and communicating them to an attorney.
